repnme.cdata!:
Panama - Water Supply and Sanitation in
            Low-Income Communities Project

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Water Supply and
            Sanitation in Low-Income Communities Project for Panama were
            as follows: outcomes were moderately satisfactory, risk to
            development outcome was moderate, Bank performance was
            moderately satisfactory, and Borrower performance was
            moderately satisfactory. Some lessons learned included:
            policy development activities are attractive activities to
            drop during execution given the general difficulties in
            implementing the activities, especially across government
            administration changes, as well as their typical low-weight
            in terms of budget assignments. Projects design should not
            rely heavily on structures that are not established at the
            outset given the probability that changes in political will
            or other unexpected occurrences can impact their creation.
            Tariff schemes should not be applied uniformly but should
            reflect the capacity and dynamics of each community. It is
            important to be sensitive to the cultural context and
            stakeholder perceptions regarding income classifications.

repnme.cdata!:
Panama - Water Supply and Sanitation in
            Low-Income Communities Project : implementation review -
            January  6 to 10, 2014

abstracts.cdata!:
This aide memoire summarizes the
            findings, recommendations and agreements reached during the
            mission of the Water and Sanitation in Panama Project (P
            ASAP). This memory aid will be disclosed publicly once the
            mission is accomplished. The Project Development Objective
            (PDO) was to increase access to sustainable water supply and
            sanitation in the communities involved. The specific
            objectives are to: l) Enable participating households and
            communities in poor rural and urban areas to access water
            and sanitation services through innovative approaches to
            provide services on a sustainable basis; 2) initiate a
            political dialogue under the leadership of MINSA and the
            generation and the knowledge base for decision making based
            on the evidence of the long-term goal of creating strong
            institutions and better focus on beneficiaries and greater
            coordination between interested parties; 3) improve
            sanitation and hygiene practices.

repnme.cdata!:
Panama - Water Supply and Sanitation in Low
            Income Communities Project : restructuring

abstracts.cdata!:
The development objective of the Water
            Supply and Sanitation in Low Income Communities Project for
            Panama is to increase access to sustainable water supply and
            sanitation services in participating communities. Under this
            restructuring, the closing date of the project is to be
            extended from November 30, 2013 until November 14, 2014. The
            extension will enable the completion of the activities and
            thus, achieve the project's objectives. The extension
            will also allow the consolidation of social and
            institutional strengthening measures, which are tightly
            linked to the long term sustainability of the project's
            investments. The extension will enable the team to provide
            further assistance in the development of rural water supply
            and sanitation (RWSS) strategy planning tool.
